text:
Problem 3.3

The Ins and Outs of Polygons: Using Supplementary Angles

In previous Investigations, we used estimation as well as tools to measure interior angles of polygons. By extending a side of a convex polygon, we can make an exterior angle that lies outside the polygon.

Notice that the measures of the exterior angle and its adjacent interior angle add up to180 degrees.

  • Arturo claims that the exterior and interior angles are supplementary. Is this true? Why?

The figures below show two ways to form exterior angles. We can extend the sides as we move in either direction around the polygon.

tiles.title: Exterior Angles Moving Counterclockwise and Clockwise

text: Measuring exterior angles provides useful information about the interior angles of a polygon.
